text: A nation is a society united by a delusion about its ancestry and by common hatred of its neighbours.
author: William Ralph Inge

text: Patriotism is often an arbitrary veneration of real estate above principles.
author: George Jean Nathan

text: 137 years later, Memorial Day remains one of America's most cherished patriotic observances. The spirit of this day has not changed - it remains a day to honor those who died defending our freedom and democracy.
author: Doc Hastings

text: Patriotism is a kind of religion it is the egg from which wars are hatched.
author: Guy de Maupassant

text: I am not an Athenian or a Greek, but a citizen of the world.
author: Diogenes
